column1: Hal was the son of [[Halfred of Overhill
column4: Mr. Boffin]] in [[Overhill]], and often went up in the [[Northfarthing]] to hunt.

column1: He had the reputation for his wild stories of things he saw. He reportedly encountered a "[[Ents
column2: Tree-man]]" while hunting beyond the [[North Moors]].<ref>{{FR

column1: The name likely comes from [[Old English]] ''hālfæst'' meaning "hale and firm".<ref>{{HM
